intro: Sisymbrium hastatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and broccoli. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium hastatum is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural fields.
